attributes.action: Instigate a 2nd EU referendum, honestly campaigned and to include 16-17 yr olds
attributes.background:
EU Membership is too important to be decided by a vote based on inaccurate campaign claims and which excluded 16-17yr olds.
The EU referendum result is not legally binding. Cameron decided that the UK should be bound by it but has subsequently resigned. His decision can & should be rescinded.
attributes.additional_details:
•	The percentage difference between Leave and Remain was not great enough to trigger such a momentous course of action - 48% voted Remain 
•	16 & 17yr olds were not included - their future is at stake & their votes should be counted
•	Voters may have been swayed by false information - eg the Leave campaigners have acknowledged their NHS claims were inaccurate. All campaign claims should be regulated by the Advertising Standards Authority to ensure accuracy and honesty for both parties.

attributes.action: Demand the EU accounts are fully disclosed. Not been audited in 20 years.
attributes.background: The accounts going back to 1994 have shown material errors, and apparently from 1994 - 2006, they have been "not entirely" fair or accurate.  Are these accounts ever released for public scrutiny? It's administered by the EU's own "Court of auditors" who give their opinion. Their own people? Why?
attributes.additional_details:
https://fullfact.org/europe/did-auditors-sign-eu-budget/

Let's see the accounts and let 'our' auditors have a look at them.  Make things open and transparent.  Or isn't that allowed in the EU?

attributes.action: Adopt a zero tolerance approach to acts of racism, in the wake of the referendum
attributes.background: Since the EU referendum, there have been numerous accounts of racism and xenophobia, where people who are in the UK legally are being abused, assaulted and/or told to "go home". A zero tolerance stance is required to show that racism and xenophobia has no place in the UK, whether in the EU or not.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/entry/eu-referendum-racism_uk_576fe161e4b08d2c56396075

attributes.action: Reinstate the weekly Widows' Pension (abolished in April 2001)
attributes.background: The weekly Widows' Pension was abolished in April 2001 and now the Conservative Government are delaying the payment of our State Pension which we and our employers have paid into and which is rightfully ours.

attributes.action: Work with governments in other countries to take action against child soldiers
attributes.background:
We are currently doing our GCSE citizenship coursework and have had to research what we would like to take action against.
#ItCouldHaveBeenUs 
#ItCouldHaveBeenYou
attributes.additional_details:
We are currently doing our GCSE citizenship coursework and have had to research what we would like to take action against. 
 We decided child soldiers as children younger than us are being kidnapped and forced to become soldiers. This is something we feel strongly and passionate about as it is something that affects children and their lives. #ItCouldHaveBeenUs 
#ItCouldHaveBeenYou

attributes.action: Make smear tests accessible at the age of consent, as opposed to at aged 25.
attributes.background: The legal national age for consent is 16. Smear tests aren't available until the age of 25. Meaning that any given woman could go for up to 9 years, without being screened for abnormal and dangerous cells.
attributes.additional_details: HPV, for example is contracted through sexual activity and is a leading cause for cervical cancer. Regardless of age, anyone can contract HPV and although it is now immunised for in most teenage girls, many women have no idea of the damage it causes before it's too late. A cervical screen test / smear test - is a method of detecting abnormal cells on the cervix. The cervix is the entrance to the womb from the vagina. Detecting and removing abnormal cervical cells can prevent cervical cancer.

attributes.action: Enforce dog licences for everyone pet owners and breeders. Toughen up on laws!
attributes.background: Everyone should be registered on a database & buy a dog licence that wants to own one! Anyone breeding be it once or several times should have to be checked by an authority to show they are equipped and have the education to do it properly, the laws need to be toughened up on those who abuse them!
attributes.additional_details: The increase in puppy prices is soring, in turn there are more irresponsible breeders and owners breeding just to make quick cash! they're not been bred for health or temprement, this is causing rescues to overflow as these puppies are growing into unhealthy untrainable and some cases dangerous dogs. This petition is to enforce licences on all dog owners and breeders and make them liable for any consequences of their dogs! Those caught not been licenced need prosecuting or jail!

attributes.action: Invest in Tidal power instead of Dangerous Nuclear Energy
attributes.background:
UK Govt. to Invest in the creation of the Severn barrage and scrap plans for Hinkley Point. The Severn project is renewable, clean energy, it will also provide 5% of the UK's energy requirements, create 50,000 jobs and can be built within just 10 years. 
Nuclear is dirty, profit driven & dangerous.
attributes.additional_details:
Some facts & quotes about the project.

''The electricity generated would be equivalent to three or four nuclear power stations and thousands of wind turbines & equivalent to 8 large coal-fired power stations. ''

- Lower cost than Hinkley Point.

- The barrage will have an operational lifetime of up to 200 year.

- It would be the world's largest ever renewable energy project.

-  Damages to wildlife from project can be avoided with additional investment of £3 Billion to migrate wildlife.

attributes.action: Do not allow universities to raise tuition fees from £9000 to the proposed £9250
attributes.background: Universities announce fees above £9,000 limit - http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/education-36845106

attributes.action: Open negotiations to join the Schengen Area.
attributes.background: Switzerland, Norway, Iceland and Liechtenstein are in Schengen without being in the EU. Schengen allows for free movement and common visa policy across Europe, without requiring welfare support for immigrants, and provides for police and judicial cooperation to fight transnational crime.
attributes.additional_details: The UK has voted to leave the European Union but many people, especially young people in Britain, value being able to travel and work freely across Europe. We value the contribution that visitors and residents from elsewhere in Europe make to our economy and society. We will likely be required to agree to freedom of movement as part of any deal to join the European Economic Area or EFTA. We could start negotiating to join Schengen before triggering formal negotiations to leave the EU.

attributes.action: Refuse any request for another Scottish independence referendum before May 2020
attributes.background: The constitution is a reserved matter and therefore no consent should be given to another Scottish referendum before May 2020.
attributes.additional_details: The Scotland Act 1998 states that the constitution is a reserved matter therefore consent has to be given by Westminster before any future Scottish independence referendum could take place.

attributes.action: Establish a constitutional convention
attributes.background: The UK has no written constitution. We also have a highly undemocratic voting system which consistently results in one party getting majority control with a minority of votes. We need a constitutional convention to address this and other issues like the House of Lords and leaving the EU.
attributes.additional_details: Local and parliamentary elections are undemocratic as voters do not get the result they voted for overall, due to the first past the post voting system. The House of Lords is entirely appointed. We have incomplete devolution and our legislature is not set up to deal with this satisfactorily. We need a constitutional convention to address these issues and draft a written constitution. With our exit from the EU having so much impact, this is the perfect time for this initiative.

attributes.action: Get water companies to remove water meters and stop profiteering from customers.
attributes.background:
Water bills have increased substantially over the last few years.Water companies say that its fairer system.we disagree as hard working families are paying more and  water companies are making bigger profits for their shareholders.
Its unjust and government should stop this profiteering.
attributes.additional_details: Talk to families and check the profit margins of companies responsible for providing water

attributes.action: Review the lack of increases in Carers Allowance for full time carers.
attributes.background:
According to a recent survey, carried out by the Carers Trust, caring for sick and/or disabled family members is taking its toll on the health of the nations unpaid carers.

This is going to lead to a care crisis in this country as well as be a massive drain on the NHS.
attributes.additional_details:
A carer needs to look after someone for a minimum 35 hours a week, in order, to receive Carers Allowance of £62.10, that`s just £1.78 an hour or less which is far below the National Living Wage and has not been increased the way pensions have.

With the effect of Austerity policies meaning that financial support for carers in the form of Council Tax and Housing benefit having been slashed we are now struggling to survive and we're forced back into part-time work to survive.

We need action now.

attributes.action: Legalise medical marijuana for chronic and terminal conditions
attributes.background: Many people in the UK suffer from painful and life-threatening conditions, such as cancer, MS, and Parkinsons.; the synthetic drugs prescribed can have nasty side effects. Research from around the world has shown that medical marijuana can improve quality of life, with fewer side effects.
attributes.additional_details:
60 peer reviewed studies of medical marijuana
http://medicalmarijuana.procon.org/view.resource.php?resourceID=000884
United States FDA report
https://www.drugabuse.gov/publications/drugfacts/marijuana-medicine

attributes.action: Mandatory dog bite prevention in the school and preschool curriculum
attributes.background: It has become apparent with recent tragic events the current system does not stop or decrease dog bites and hospitalisation . I feel education in dog handling and bite prevention is a key area in tackling dog bites as the largest demographic is young children , many bites can be prevented.
attributes.additional_details:
Bite statistics rise every year . Far too much blame is put on the breed of dog luring many owners of other breeds into a false sense of security . Many of the worlds top trainers and behaviourists such as victoria stillwell , jo rosie , nando brown , cesar millan all disagree with breed specific legislation and promote bite prevention , education and responsible dog ownership. Nearly all dog bites are preventable . 
Lets teach our children how to be safe around dogs!

attributes.action: Facilitate 100% mortgages for those renting privately.
attributes.background: There is gap in the 'help to buy' scheme that doesn't facilitate those people who are stuck in the private rental market.  People that regularly evidence the ability to make mortgage payment, but do not have the ability to put away enough savings to reach a 5-10% deposit.
attributes.additional_details: There is a next generation issue, of those people that have young families but are now stuck in the rental market.  Quite often the rental costs are higher than what a mortgage would cost, but due to the often higher rental changes to facilitate a family home these people can not accrue enough savings quickly enough to purchase a property.

attributes.action: Build social housing for wounded soldiers
attributes.background: I would like the government to find the money to build council houses for wounded soldier's.

attributes.action: Improve patient choice for the use of CHC Funding
attributes.background: CCG's have cut the number of of care homes they will allow a patient to choose from to use their CHC Funding.  Patients cannot choose care settings not on these limited lists even if they are prepared to pay the top-up and they have a better CQC rating causing great upset to patients and families.
attributes.additional_details: Patients are being prevented from choosing their own care setting under CCG red tape that prevents them from choosing a home that isn't on a predetermined list.  This is the case even when a patient or their family agree to pay the top up so the cost of the home of choice is no more than any other on 'the list'.  This red tape is preventing patients from choosing homes that are close to relatives and that have a better CQC rating than ones approved by the CCG for their list.

attributes.action: Make gender/sexuality a compulsory topic in PSHEE/P&E lessons in UK high schools
attributes.background: Many genders and sexualities are unheard of by most people, meaning it is difficult for those questioning to find a label which describes them. I think introducing a gender and sexuality topic in PSHEE/P&E classes in all high schools would assist those questioning and lessen homophobia in schools.
attributes.additional_details: Although the statistic for LGBT+ students is estimated, around 1 in 5 students are believed to be a part of the community. This means that approximately 646,900 students are LGBT+ and would benefit from this topic, as well as the remainder of students who will be more educated and aware of the many genders and sexualities there are.

attributes.action:
ban cycle racing on the public roads
And make cyclist use the cycle paths
attributes.background: I was driving the other day just come round the bend and there was 3 of them next to eachover taking up the road and could not pass its so dangerous
attributes.additional_details:
ban cycle racing on the public roads
I would like the government to ban cycle racing on public roads. On our busy streets their is no place for sports cycle racing, its highly dangerous with cyclists often racing three abreast and not moving in on narrow roads to allow faster traffic to pass. clubs should rent tracks to race on cars and motorbikes have to , cyclists pay no road tax,have no insurance etc, pleasure cycling and commuting should be encouraged on cycle paths only but racing banned

attributes.action: Review the cases of each of the 3859 prisoners still held under IPP scheme
attributes.background: As of September, 3,859 prisoners were still in custody after being sentenced to an IPP and more than 8/10 were beyond the expiry date of the original sentence. IPP was scrapped in 2012. What they have served is disproportionate to the crimes they have committed.

attributes.action: Reduction of tuition fees to £6,000 per annum
attributes.background: We spend most of our youth in school, to then spend the rest of our lives paying it off. Lowering the fees provides greater opportunities to educate more of our society and potentially help the disadvantaged.

attributes.action: Ban all non-recyclable/non-compostable packaging in the UK
attributes.background:
The UK fails to recycle over 1.5 million tonnes of plastic packaging waste each year, which ends up in landfill & waterways instead. 

Creating packaging that our society cannot deal with is blatantly unsustainable. We urgently need 100% recyclable/compostable packaging on every product in the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK currently recycles 64% of all packaging waste, but only about 32% of plastic packaging waste.

This is unacceptable. We cannot let big business create more packaging that our society cannot deal with - it may be good for profits but it is irresponsible and unsustainable.

We call upon our leaders to take action: to ban all non-sustainable packaging on all products, with a grace period of 5 years to allow manufacturers to integrate viable, sustainable alternatives into their supply chains.

attributes.action: Meet full cost of Student Nurse training from National Health Contributions.
attributes.background: There is a recognised shortage of nurses in this country.  There exists the possibility that Brexit will have a further impact.  Nurses are essential to the health of our nation.  It must be an imperative of government to implement a future-proof plan to ensure the ready supply of qualified nurses.
attributes.additional_details: Any discussions previously held about the future funding of nurse training were, no doubt, pre-Brexit.  An Act of Parliament that serves to ensure the recruitment of talented people into nursing must be considered an essential and positive step.  The reliance on young people (and others) to borrow in order to fund their nursing care training renders this much-needed recruitment uncertain, and therefore at risk from external forces.  The State as priniciple employer must ensure adequate funding.

attributes.action: Make it tougher for foreign buyers to purchase UK properties
attributes.background: Places like Denmark, Singapore, Hong Kong, Switzerland & Australia have made it much tougher or more expensive for foreign buyers to snap up homes. However, UK still allows foreigners to buy and sell properties as they wish, making profits but pushing up prices which many UK families cannot afford.
attributes.additional_details:
We ask that the needs of the British people be met first. A lot of foreign investment properties are empty when British workers are finding it harder and harder to even rent a place. 

Currently UK property developers like to pre-sell their developments to overseas buyers because, unlike UK buyers, they pay a deposit of 20% even before the project has started. It helps to finance their projects but makes Brits second priority.

attributes.action: Extend NHS staff lunch breaks from 30 minutes to 1 hour, 30 minutes isn't enough
attributes.background: As you know NHS staff work under immense stress and pressure, saving lives on a daily basis. Staff working in these conditions should be given adequate time to get away from the department and relieve themselves of stress. Working under intense pressure without adequate rest can lead to fatigue.
attributes.additional_details: Working in stressful environments without adequate time to relax can lead to stress, fatigue and ultimately making mistakes which can put lives at risk, we believe staff should have enough time to get away from the department and unwind. 30 minutes is nowhere near enough time to leave the department, pick up lunch and then have time to eat before being late back for shift. We propose that lunch breaks should be extended to 1 hour or 45 minutes at the least to ensure staff have time to eat,relax.

attributes.action: Organise a Brexit referendum for 15 to 17 year olds
attributes.background: I am a 15 year old girl who feels that her future has been ignored by those voting in the Brexit referendum. I believe we can show the government that the outcome could have been very different if our views had been taken into account.

attributes.action: Change the law to ensure the safety of children crossing roads near schools
attributes.background:
Make it compulsory for local councils to be held accountable for ensuring that children can cross busy, dangerous roads safely when walking to school.
Local councils currently do not have to provide a solution for children crossing busy roads and it is at their discretion.
attributes.additional_details: On gypsy lane in Nuneaton, 2 crossing patrol staff members have unfortunately been unable to fulfil their roles due to extremely sad circumstances. As a result children are having to cross an incredibly busy, dangerous road, resulting in children nearly being hit at speed by dangerous drivers. Due to the current legal requirements, the police nor the council have to provide safe passage which is putting children at serious risk. The duty of care is non existent and this needs to change.

attributes.action: Stop plans to pay for the restoration of properties belonging to the super rich.
attributes.background: In the current economic climate, it is morally wrong to use public funds to pay for the restoration of such buildings as Wentworth Woodhouse and Buckingham Palace. The owners of said properties should be the ones to pay and the money earmarked for this should be passed on to the NHS immediately.

attributes.action: To give assistant/therapy dogs the same recognition as Guide and Hearing dogs.
attributes.background: Guide/Hearing Dogs are recognised by shops to give them admission. However, therapy and assistance don't have the rights to enter establishments with those they support, this disadvantages the person the dog is with. I am looking to give these useful dogs the same recognition in law.

attributes.action: Free Commando Sergeant Alexander Blackman from jail
attributes.background: A soldier should never go to prison for killing the enemy in a battlefield situation. Sergeant Alexander Blackman was sent to prison for killing a member of the Taliban on a battlefield in Afghanistan. Commando Sergeant Alexander Blackman should not be in prison.

attributes.action: Ensure Gender Inequality is taught as part of secondary school curriculum.
attributes.background: Our aim is to spread awareness of the impact in which these subtle but meaningful gender stereotypes impact on women, men and children in society unwittingly. Promote high self esteem as well as to recognize the impact these portrayals have on different people.

attributes.action: Lower the amount of signatures needed for discussion in parliament to 25000
attributes.background: The minimum signatures required for discussion in parliament is too high at 100,000

attributes.action: Stop the UK from recognising child marriage conducted abroad as legal.
attributes.background:
The UK recognises child marriage provided they were conducted "legally" abroad & also for benefit purposes.
It is illegal to marry under 18 yrs of age in the UK (16 years with parental consent) & these child marriages should not be recognised by the UK in any form. The adult should be prosecuted.
attributes.additional_details:
Today Save the Children estimated that a girl marries under the age of 15 years every 7 second seconds within the world.
In recognising the child marriages of immigrants to the UK (including for benefit purposes) we do nothing to stop this child abuse.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of honey in order to fight the decline in bee populations
attributes.background: The impact that the honey industry has on bee populations is detrimental - by taking away their honey, we are depriving them of their ability to feed their young and to insulate their hives. We demand a total ban on the sale of honey in the UK to help protect our bees from extinction.
attributes.additional_details:
Recently, there has been lots of media coverage surrounding the decline in bee populations. It is no secret that if bees go extinct, we are only a couple of years behind.
Bees produce honey for two reasons – to feed their young, and to insulate their hives, therefore by taking their honey from them we are depriving them of their ability to carry out these essential survival functions. It is vital that we stop this practice for the bees' sake, for our sake and for the sake of our planet.

attributes.action: Keep the ban on building new Grammars and keep the Comprehensive school system.
attributes.background: Theresa May has said she wants to bring back grammars this could take away opportunities for people like me who have learning difficulties as well as bring in a class divide because of tutors to help kids pass the test pricing others out.

attributes.action: Instate the death penalty for all paedophiles.
attributes.background: The European Convention of Human Rights has interfered with the rights of British children to be protected from the most depraved individuals infesting our society. The death penalty should be instated against all pedophiles, as the ultimate deterrent and the ultimate protection for our children.
attributes.additional_details: Paedophilia, parallels genocide as one of the most vile acts committed against the most vulnerable. It is our duty to protect children from all levels of harm. The present legal system of a few years to life in prison for pedophiles, fails completely to protect children. The soft penalty of prison, does nothing to deter offenders and entices paedophiles released from prison to offend again, and again and again. Hanging paedophiles will make them think twice before harming children.

attributes.action: Allow people resident in UK for 5 years to vote in the 2nd EU Referendum
attributes.background: Non British citizen resident in UK for more than 5 years are a vital part of this country as they are taxpayers and contributing actively to the future of the country. By law they could ask to become British citizens so it's only fair to give them the right to vote in such an important Referendum.

attributes.action: Enforce senior drivers to re-take their driving test
attributes.background: Lots of senior drivers didn't have to sit a formal driving test and even more didn't have to sit one that was adequate. It should be a legal requirement for drivers at the age of 70 to re-sit a upto date driving test that they desperately need. This would improve the safety of roads in general

attributes.action: Do not stop PSA Prostate Specific Antigen tests for men.
attributes.background: I have have suffered prostate cancer and had a prostatectomy. The issue was highlighted following a blood test for PSA. I had no symptoms, don't smoke or drink and keep fit
attributes.additional_details:
It was the my manager who encouraged me to go for a test following a friend suffering the disease. Had I not had the test I would now be in the advanced stages of cancer and do not know how long I would have to live. 
Further to this I know of three other men with the same story.
If this is stopped men will die.PSA test will show your individual PSA level and enable you monitor of your reading. Its a simple blood test and nothing more.

attributes.action: Issue a two-year flight ban for travelers who cause disruption on airplanes
attributes.background: Airplane security is essential not only when combatting terrorism but for travelers to feel generally safe and ensure there are no added risks to flying. Recently, poor or drunken behaviour by some travelers has caused distress and has even required planes to be diverted.
attributes.additional_details: Increasingly there are stories of drunken and rowdy passengers causing problems on flights in and around Europe. Unfortunately, many of these are British travelers. At a time when airline safety is critical, this unwanted behaviour is creating added pressure and fining the travelers is often not a strong enough sanction. A two-year flight ban would hopefully be a more suitable sanction and also act as a deterrent.

attributes.action: Record biometric data for all migrants and refugees entering the United Kingdom
attributes.background: To protect UK citizens from criminal or terrorist acts by refugees and migrants and to protect those refugees and migrants from exploitation and harm. Obtaining biometric data will remove anonymity, allowing the welfare of migrants to be monitored and providing a deterrent to crime and terrorism.

attributes.action: The Government  inaugurates a system to record all entry and exit to Britain.
attributes.background: It is becoming obvious that it is only fair to allow existing migrants to stay provided they are contributing but this must NOT include new migrants since Brexit has been decided upon.  The Government must insist that all subsequent visitors/migrants have passports with biometric information within.
attributes.additional_details: All new British Passports issued have a 'chip' embedded and many other Countries too have biometric information which is essential for proper registration of those entering and leaving Britain.  It has been used to great effect in the US and Britain must have the same security measures.  Such a requirement should not be seen as discriminatory by the EU as British Citizens are required to have the same information.  Mrs May has failed to install a system as Home Secretary and must rectify as PM.

attributes.action: To not close heart departments especially for babies and children.
attributes.background: They are very important and as parent of a heart baby who died knows how important they are, it's more common than people realise, those who haven't been there don't understand but let's put it this way how would you cope with loosing a baby/child with an unexpected heart problem with no where to go
attributes.additional_details: I no lots of heart babies/children that with out these hospitals or departments wouldn't be here now. You are being selfish and need to think these things through I can't thank the hospital we were under enough for what they did. Just think about it first, what if the boot was on the other foot

attributes.action: Judicial inquiry into Leave and Remain campaigns with repeat EU Referendum
attributes.background: We request: (i) a full independent judicial inquiry into the conduct of all parties involved with both official, and other, campaigns; and (ii) that the EU Referendum is repeated so that the UK public is able to vote on the basis of fair and balanced, rather than misleading, campaign statements.
attributes.additional_details: The recent EU Referendum was characterised by false and misleading statements from both Leave, Remain and other parties.

attributes.action: No action to leave the EU until Parliament has approved  alternative policy
attributes.background: No detailed alternative policy on relations with EU was set out in referendum. Our elected representatives should approve one as a basis for negotiation with the EU before Article 50 or other measures are initiated to trigger departure

attributes.action: Build a Train Station at the Terminal Building of Cardiff International Airport
attributes.background:
We the undersigned call on the Government to implement the above, accordingly intersecting the railway line which runs adjacent to the airport, and urge the relevant train operators to incorporate it into their regular timetables.

Cardiff Airport is in need of investment in order for it to grow.
attributes.additional_details:
Many people in Wales feel that the airport is not within easy reach of the general public unless they have access to a private vehicle. The remote station in the village of Rhoose is an impractical substitute, and straightforward, competitive alternatives are limited.

This affects local passengers as well as visitors.

Rail infrastructure is not currently devolved to the Welsh Gov’t, and any new stations would be a decision for the UK Gov’t & Network Rail.

attributes.action: Participate in the UN conference to negotiate a Treaty to ban nuclear weapons.
attributes.background: The conference, which is set to take place in New York with the first session in March 2017, represents a significant opportunity to make real progress towards a worldwide nuclear weapons ban.
attributes.additional_details: Whilst repeatedly claiming to support multilateral nuclear disarmament, successive governments appear to have done very little towards actually bringing it about. The forthcoming United Nations conference is an opportunity for this government to send out a message globally that it is serious about achieving a world free of nuclear weapons.

attributes.action: Impose sanctions against the Philippine government for extra-judicial killings
attributes.background: The Philippine government is openly cleansing it's society of criminals by executing them. It is unacceptable for Britain to trade with a country that supports this policy. We demand that suspected criminals receive a fair trial as detailed in Article 10 of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights
attributes.additional_details:
Drug addiction is linked to poor life chances and trauma and many addicts require support and don't deserve to be killed. 
https://www.drugabuse.gov/related-topics/addiction-science
